ChiefComplaint.ID: Ms. Rogers is a 56-year-old white female having chest pains for the last week.

HistoryOfPresentIllness.GeneralHealth: Usual state of good health until one week prior to admission.
HistoryOfPresentIllness.InitialOnset: Abrupt onset of chest pain in left para-sternal area, radiating up to her neck.

InitialEpisode.Relief: Resolved with rest in a cool area.

SurgicalHistory.Procedure: Total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral oophorectomy for uterine fibroids.

MedicalHistory.Treatment: Unknown medication, stopped after 6 months due to drowsiness.

AlcoholUse.Frequency: 1 or 2 beers each weekend; 1 glass of wine once a week with dinner.

Gastrointestinal.EpigastricPain: Burning in quality, approximately twice a month, primarily at night.

Musculoskeletal.LowerBackPain: Aching in quality, approximately once every week after working in her garden. Relieved with Tylenol.

GeneralCommentsNotes.ReasonForVisit: Define the reason for the patient's visit as specifically as possible.

NatureOfProblem.AcuteOrChronic: Convey the acute or chronic nature of the problem.

NaturalHistory.SinceOnset: Describe the natural history of her problem since its onset.
NaturalHistory.NewCircumstances: Change or new circumstances to the problem.

GeneralCommentsNotes.ReasonForVisit: Reason she came in for visit.
GeneralCommentsNotes.PatientReliefAttempts: What has the patient tried for relief?

RelevantROS.PositiveAndNegative: Relevant positive and negative ROS for this complaint.
RelevantROS.SystemReview: Review of systems for the relevant organ system.

Medications.ReactionType: Always list the type of reported reaction.

GeneralCommentsNotes.DiseasePresence: Comment specifically on the presence or absence of diseases relevant to the chief complaint.
GeneralCommentsNotes.ROSSection: Separate each ROS section for easy identification. OK to refer to HPI if adequately covered there.
GeneralCommentsNotes.Findings: List positive and negative findings in brief, concise phrases or sentences.
